Just do assertEquals on expected and actual collections. The
collections all have sensible equals methods

i.e. if the 2 collections are lists they will be equal if they
contain the same elements in the same order. If the 2 collections
are sets they will be equal if they contain the same elements.

--- In junit@y..., "kms_junit" <kms_junit@y...> wrote:
> I'm new to JUnit, and have been trying to find a way to determine 
if 
> the items in 2 collections are the same. I created a collection ( 
> collection "A") that contains my expected results. My test case 
> creates a collection (collection "B"). Now I need to ensure that 
the 
> items in "A" are the same items that are in "B". I can create my 
own 
> method that takes both collections as parameters and returns a 
> boolean if the items are the same ( by looping through the 
> collections) but was wondering if there was a way to use an assert* 
> method to do the same thing.
> 
> Thanks.
